Sheet1.Name: Boston Medical Center (BMC) Preventive Food Pantry
Sheet1.Brief Description: This Food Pantry works with BMC patients with special nutritional needs or financial barriers to food. BMC primary care providers must write 𰲥scriptions񠦯r supplemental foods. The Pantry is often used by patients with cancer, HIV/AIDS, hypertension, diabetes, obesity, heart disease and other chronic conditions. May only visit once every two weeks.
Sheet1.Address: Yawkey Ambulatory Care Center at Boston Medical Center Basement, 850 Harrison Ave, Boston, MA 02118
Sheet1.Cost: Free, but need 𰲥sription񠦲om BMC physician

Sheet1.Name: Brookline Community Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: Located in Brookline Village in front of Brothers & Sisters Co.

Sheet1.Name: Cambridge Community Center Food Pantry
Sheet1.Brief Description: Offer groceries for ~1,000 households each week from the CCC gymnasium. Less than a 10 minute walk from Harvard Square or Central T stop.

Sheet1.Name: Coast Community Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: Located at the Cambridge Community Center in Cambridge Riverside neighborhood just outside of Central Square.

Sheet1.Name: Earthy Boston񳠆enway Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: Located in front of Mei Mei Dumplings in the Fenway area.

Sheet1.Name: East End House Food Pantry
Sheet1.Brief Description: This Food Pantry provides individuals and families in need with fresh fruits and vegetables, canned and dry goods, meats, and dairy products. Eligibility: On your first visit, you will be required to fill out an intake form. Please bring your I.D. and a form of income verification. For income verification, we accept a paystub, a Medicare or Mass Health card, a DTA/EBT card, a referral, a benefit statement, or any other document that proves your income status.
Sheet1.Cost: Free, eligibility applies: must present ID (Mass Health, library card, local supermarket card, EBT card, referral, etc.) and proof of residency (mail, bank statement, utility bill, etc.)

Sheet1.Name: Elnora Yard Food Pantry at St. Paul African Methodist Episcopal Church
Sheet1.Brief Description: The Elnora Yard Food Pantry provides food up to twice a week for families and individuals in need. The eligibility requirements are proof of residence, a registration client intake form that is renewed every year, and proof of household.
Sheet1.Cost: Free, but must bring proof of residence, a registration client intake form that is renewed every year, and proof of household.

Sheet1.Name: First Church Friday Café
Sheet1.Brief Description: The Friday Café weekly daytime drop-in program, offers a welcoming space where homeless and housed adults can gather and get to know each other. At the Friday Caf鬠people experiencing a wide variety of life circumstances can relax, share a meal, and talk together as friends.

Sheet1.Name: Haley House Food Pantry
Sheet1.Brief Description: Every Thursday, tickets are distributed to those who interested at 7:00am, and bags are distributed at 10:00am. All are welcome.

Sheet1.Name: Haley House Soup Kitchen
Sheet1.Brief Description: The Haley House Soup Kitchen offers fresh, made-from-scratch meals five days a week. Lunch is served on Sundays from 2-3pm, and breakfast is served from Tuesday through Friday from 8-9:30am.
Sheet1.Hours: Sunday from 2:00-3:00pm for lunch (snacks from noon), Tuesday to Friday from 8-9:30am for breakfast (coffee and snacks from 6am)

Sheet1.Name: Harvard Square Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: Located at the Democracy Center. Stocked by volunteers and restaurants, as well as weekly grocery trips.

Sheet1.Name: Harvard Square Homeless Shelter
Sheet1.Brief Description: Student-run homeless shelter that provides meals, sandwiches, drinks, hand warmers, and other supplies at the door.
Sheet1.Hours: Food at the door from ~7-11pm daily.

Sheet1.Name: Hope Fellowship Church
Sheet1.Brief Description: Hope Fellowship Church provides a to-go dinner to serve neighbors who are in need every Sunday from 4-5:30pm and Tuesday from 4:30-5:30pm.

Sheet1.Name: Jamaica Plain Community Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: Set up behind City Feed and Supply on Centre Street.

Sheet1.Name: Lynn Community Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: Open 24/7 at Centerboard. Anyone in need is welcome to stop by to grab food.

Sheet1.Name: Malden Community Fridge (Beach St)
Sheet1.Brief Description: One of three Malden Community Fridges, located at Linden Square Municipal Lot. There is also a micro-pantry adjacent.

Sheet1.Name: Malden Community Fridge (Faulkner St)
Sheet1.Brief Description: One of three Malden Community Fridges, located across from the community garden, behind the U-Haul.

Sheet1.Name: Malden Community Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: One of three Malden Community Fridges, located across from the Cambridge Health Alliance office.

Sheet1.Name: Margaret Fuller Neighborhood House Food Pantry
Sheet1.Brief Description: Large-volume food pantry in Cambridge with access to fresh produce open to residents of Cambridge and Greater Boston. Patrons may receive food up to twice per month. In order to register, an individual needs to bring proof of address to the pantry and complete the brief registration form on-site.
Sheet1.Hours: 4:00-6:30pm on Wednesday, 2-5pm on Thursday, 9am-noon on Friday, 10am-1pm on Saturday, closed Sunday-Tuesday
Sheet1.Cost: Free, but must bring proof of address in Cambridge or Greater Boston. May receive food 2x per month.

Sheet1.Name: Mattapan Community Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: Located by Cafe Juice Up. Also included non-food supplies like PPE, menstrual products, diapers, etc.

Sheet1.Name: NewHealth Community Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: Community Fridge at the NewHealth Charlestown Health Center. The fridge is open 24/7 to the public.

Sheet1.Name: Newton Community Freedge
Sheet1.Brief Description: The fridge is located in Newton񳠎onantum neighborhood, in the parking lot of Central Drapery and Dry Cleaning.

Sheet1.Name: Rosie񳠐lace Dining Room
Sheet1.Brief Description: Dining room open 365 days a year serving breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Sheet1.Name: Rosie񳠐lace Food Pantry
Sheet1.Brief Description: Provide 350 households every day with fresh meat, dairy, fruits, vegetables, non-perishable staples, household essentials and COVID tests. Women who can visit the Pantry every week to help make ends meet.

Sheet1.Name: Roslindale Community Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: Located outside of the Roslindale Market.

Sheet1.Name: Solutions at Work Meals at Central Square
Sheet1.Brief Description: Meals given five nights a week at 4:30 PM, 60 meals each night, plus toiletries, backpacks, sleeping bags, etc. Not a specific location, but people going around the Square.

Sheet1.Name: Somerville Community Fridge (Prospect St)
Sheet1.Brief Description: One of three Somerville Community Fridges, located at 35 Prospect Street.

Sheet1.Name: Somerville Community Fridge (Sewall St)
Sheet1.Brief Description: One of three Somerville Community Fridges, located near the Temple Street Walgreens on 36 Sewall Street.

Sheet1.Name: Somerville Community Fridge (St Clements Rd)
Sheet1.Brief Description: One of three Somerville Community Fridges, located at 33 St. Clement Road in Medford.

Sheet1.Name: South End Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: In front of Make Shift Boston, an affordable co-working and events space on Columbus Avenue.

Sheet1.Name: St. Monica Food Pantry
Sheet1.Brief Description: Has a mission to provide weekly groceries for individuals and families living with hunger as well as emergency meals and food for anyone who knocks on their door.
Sheet1.Address: St. Monica's Lower Church Hall, 331 Old Colony Avenue, South Boston, MA 02127

Sheet1.Name: Symphony Interfaith Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: Hosted by Northeastern University Hillel, the Catholic Center, and the Center for Spirituality.

Sheet1.Name: The Brighton Center Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: Located at the Brighton Allston Congregational Church.

Sheet1.Name: The Faneuil Street Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: Set up outside Oliveira Deli Market in Oak Square. Could contain fresh produce, pantry items, prepared meals, water, etc.

Sheet1.Name: The Salvation Army Community Feeding Program
Sheet1.Brief Description: The Salvation Army serves meals daily to participants at their Drop-In Shelter, The Lodge, Senior Citizens, and the children of Our Place. Cambridge residents join every Wednesday night for a community dinner. Anyone in need of a warm, nutritious meal is welcome.

Sheet1.Name: Watertown Community Fridge
Sheet1.Brief Description: See what you need, give what you can. Community Fridge open 24/7.

Sheet1.Name: Women’s Lunch Place
Sheet1.Brief Description: A nutritious breakfast and lunch, seasonal gear, toiletries, undergarments, feminine hygiene products, and other basic necessities are always available at our 67 Newbury St. location. Also provide one-on-one assistance to women experiencing homelesness from a daytime shelter and advocacy center in Boston.
